newsitem.title: CANADA: Talisman bolsters North Sea activity.
newsitem.headline: Talisman bolsters North Sea activity.

text.p: Talisman Energy Inc said on Tuesday it added landholdings in and around its operated North Sea properties and drilled a successful horizontal well in the region.
The activity took place at the Beatrice, Buchan and Clyde fields, which Talisman acquired in December 1996 and now has net production averaging 23,000 barrels of oil a day.
Calgary-based Talisman said it agreed to buy Broken Hill Proprietary Co Ltd unit BHP Petroleum's 17.5 percent stake in two blocks adjacent to the Clyde field.
After the transaction, expected to close in June, Talisman's interests will be 30 percent in Block 30/18 East and 18.75 percent in Block 30/18 West.

Talisman also acquired North Sea interests from Kerr-McGee Corp's U.K. subsidiary including an additional 25 percent interest in the Beatrice field and Nigg terminal, bringing Talisman's total interest to 68 percent in both assets, it said.
The transaction included a 39 percent stake in Block 13/22b, which contains the undeveloped Phoenix gas condensate discovery about 20 km from the Talisman-operated Ross Field.
The company said it estimated that the Phoenix field could contain 30 million barrels of oil equivalent in discovered reserves.
Meanwhile, Talisman's first operated horizontal development well at Clyde came on production in March at 1,800 barrels a day and output rose to 3,020 barrels a day, it said.
The production rate was expected to continue to rise as the well cleaned up, it said.
Talisman's interest in the field is 51 percent. Partners include Royal Dutch/Shell and Exxon Corp unit Esso with 24.5 percent each.

Talisman also said it signed an agreement with the owners of the Forties Pipeline System to receive a reduced toll rate from January 1, 1997 for its share of oil from the blocks that include the Buchan field.
The move was expected to extend the field's life and promote further exploration and development work in the vacinity, Talisman said.
